transcript.content: Jet - Rollover DJ
Rollover DJ by Jet on Xfm 104.9.
I'm Ricky Gervais. With me Stephen Merchant and Karl Pilkington.
Alright, Karl?
Yep.
Bit miserable today Karl. Let me explain why-
Go on.
-Steve, and to you the listeners. Well, we came in to a big, big bunch of stuff dropped off by, who was it, Becky from Marks and Spencers? Just like lovely stuff.
Food, presents for the cat, books... just you know 'to Ricky and Steve', 'Ricky and Steve', 'Ricky and Steve who do the show'. All right, 'Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant'
GQ presenters of the Year.
Creators of The Office', right?
Award winning.
Karl was looking over, I go oh... well maybe... no it's for you, no. And then... then he told me why he's grumpy anyway.
Go on.
Do you know what Xfm are giving everyone- he's been- how long have you been here?
About six years.
What you getting for Christmas from Xfm?
Two CDs.
Is that of your choice or do they choose them?
There's a list of about thirty.
Right.
Tell him what you chose.
I've gone for Kings of Leon album, and The Best of Bob Marley.
Haven't we, like, given them away in the past or something? Or you could have burnt them off couldn't you, you could have done copies - illegal, but you could have done that... anytime you wanted.
I don't think Bob Marley minds if you bootleg his CDS.
It's out of order tho innit.
It is bad.
Although you do get-
Has that always been the case, has it always been the true of all the time you've been here?
No, it been better than this.
Yeah, although you do get paid quite well, you do have an easier time.
Yeah, but don't give me the CDs then. If I was a milkman, you don't go, "have two bottles of semi-skimmed. Happy Christmas".
Ricky laughs
That is a valid point
Do you know what I mean?
Who was it that made this decision?
There's no point, no point is there.
Why?
There's no point, I don't like moaning anyway, just...
Ricky laughs
Has it come from up top? Is it like from the Capital people?
Just- just everyone- that's what everyone gets.
Yeah.
Yeah but hold on, will Christian get two CDs for getting up at 4:30 every day for about five years.
And keeping this station afloat.
Probably. So, that's why I'm a bit fed up.
What you going to listen to first, Marley or Leon?
Probably have a bit of Marley.
I'll tell you what Marley is good for as well. You have a little beach holiday aren't you, over Christmas, going to Lanzarote.
Hmm.
Listening to that on the beach. You'll realise how wise Xfm are in the long run.
You know, you'll go "well look they could have given me 400 quid right, but I'd have spent that", but this is you know, the legend lives on.
It's the gift that keeps on giving.
So, you probably, you know what I mean. Think how much those two-

All you've gotta think of is how much those all his great songs took. Not only from the depths of his soul and you know, all his sort of angst and knowledge and love... And then all the studio time, the marketing.
And they just giving you one, they go, "don't worry about that Karl, just have it".
You go, "what, all the time they spent with Bob Marley and everything?"
"Yeah have it Karl, have it Karl, have it Karl"
Gratis.
"Yeah, have that, have that, thanks, well done, carry on. We're still going to pay you for the work. That's just something on top!"
Yeah so don't moan, it's extra. So... they didn't have to give you it at all.
Play a record you ungrateful little swine.
Some people, like the homeless, aren't getting anything this Christmas.
This is my favourite Elvis Costello track of all time. It's Alison.
This wasn't on the list.
Ricky sniggers
Alright?
Elvis Costello - Alison
Elvis Costello - Alison, on Xfm 104.9.
So, that's it... maybe... I'll tell you what...

Good idea, Karl: just beg. Just ask for other...things... What do you want? What do you want for Christmas? You must have big fan base that they're willing to make you things. Maybe like a little, I dunno... gloves? Pair of gloves.
Woolly hat.
If they want to send a necklace in for Suzanne that'd be handy.
Oh, yeah.
That's what she wants.
Is Suzanne listening today?
No, she's out.
Right, ok, this is the dilemma: me and Steve yesterday
Were trying to convince Karl that it would be a good idea to buy Suzanne a Christmas present, ok?
Now why aren't you gonna buy a present? Explain, Karl, why you don't think you should buy a Christmas present.
No, well I've told her I'll get a one, but in the new year. We're going away on holiday and that, so there's no point taking stuff away.
Yeah.
Going to Lanzarote next week.
Just get her something in the sales after Christmas, yeah?
Yeah.
Right. And me and Steve were trying to explain to Karl that she would love it if you bought her something on Christmas day.
Yeah, but she knows now.
But- yeah-
Knows what?
I've told her, I said she's getting-
No, well I'm gonna tell, do you know... right, this... Dear listener, this was Karl's worry.
I said I bet she's got you something, and Karl was worried in case he got her something and she hadn't got him something.
Yeah, he'd be livid.
He didn't want to be down. He didn't wanna be a present down.
Yeah.
Look his face! So buy her a nice necklace. Don't spend- just spend a hundred quid, you know, just a little token-
We're going away. I'm taking her away on holiday.
No you're not taking her away on holiday... what, you're paying for it are you?
...er, yeah.
Are you really?
Yeah. Well... half and half, and that.
So you're paying for you to go on holiday. That's good of ya. So the gift is your company really.
... She's done alright.
She's done alright??
Why do you talk like you're 60 years old? And you've been working down the mines.
Ricky laughs
I love that, she's done alright.
Do you go home to her and say Suzanne, you're bloody lucky-
I mean...
-you've fallen on your feet, look who you've got-
To be fair, Rick, I'm not sure she has done alright.
Ricky laughs
I don't wanna be critical, but...
(laughing) Oh dear.
So what you gonna get in the sales?
What are you gonna get her?
Well it depends. I'm thinking... I mean, I'll give her the choice, she can have Kings of Leon or Bob Marley.
Ricky laughs
Right? I'll let her decide there.
(laughing) Oh dear.
Er...
I can't wait to see you. Where are you going, Lanzarote?
Yeah.
Where's that?
Dunno, Suzanne sorted it.

I said, I said, I said Lanzarote, is that... is that Africa or is it Spain or Portugal? Just talking and he goes "dunno" and I went... what do you mean you don't know? I went what's the currency and he went "dunno". I said... Suzanne booked this one did she?
Yeah, so, where is it? Is it- is Lanzarote African or-
Foreign. Somewhere foreign.

I was looking last night and it doesn't look that good. There was, like, one of the highlights, the things it says you've got to do, is go and have... apparently they've got restaurants in caves... and that's like one of the things they say you must do. So, if that's a highlight... do you know what I mean?
So we'll do that. Go and see what that's like.
Yeah.
When you're on the beach, Karl, do you wear the very, very tight Speedos?
No.
What do you wear?
Sort of longish shorts, t-shirt on probably, with a sort of a light shirt on top of that.
Right, sure.
So what, quite wrapped up then.
Covered up. Do you wear a hat because obviously the bald head there's a risk of sunburn.
No, just put a little lotion on it.
Lotion on there.
Yeah. Just have a bit of a wander, wander down the beach, have a look.
See if there's any old blokes with their tackle out and a backpack.
I look forward to so... There you go.
Well, we're looking forward to finding out how you get on. And interested to know what she gives you on Christmas Day.
More scintillating chat after this next song.
Right, bit of Placebo?
Yeah, love it, love it, love it.
Special Needs.
Ricky giggles
Placebo - Special Needs
Placebo. Special Needs. On Xfm 104.9.

Email in where Lanzarote is. I don't know if it's Italy or Spain, off Europe or maybe Africa. You know, this is the sort of things, these are reasons I come in here, to at least learn summat, innit Karl?
We stopped Educating Ricky. So I've stopped- I've stopped learning, you know about things like the woman who ate mud all her life.
I taught you something before when we were in the office-
Go on, what was that? What did you teach me?
Er, they've just counted how many fish are in the sea and that.
No. No, they haven't.
What?
Just done a census.
A census...
What, of fish?
Yeah, some fellas have gone in the sea and they've got to workout, there's about...
"Mrs Sprat, is this you son?"
"No, he's a lodger."
"Ok let's mark him down. That's two. Oh I've lost count! Six million four hundred- oh darn!"
So how many are there?
About... it's a lot.
Ricky laughs
Well, there are more species of fish...
Than bird, mammal, and reptile, put together-
Can I ask a question?
That's on my DVD of Animals.
(Sales voice) That's still available in shops. Probably find that online, get it slightly cheaper.
(Sales voice) £15.99.
What? Go on, ask me a question.
(Sales voice) Karl Pilkington's also on the DVD. That's a perfect Christmas gift.

Yeah, this is a question I was discussing this yesterday. I'm not- this is not a joke. I genuinely have always always been slightly perplexed, and we were discussing it last night, the notion of 'the birds and the bees'.
Yeah.
I don't mean, you know... 'the birds and the bees', I understand how...
Why they use 'the birds and the bees'?
Yeah because well you see I always, as a child, I never... I assumed the bees were having some kind of relations with the birds.
No.
So what's- is there anything to do with the birds and the bees? Or is it literally, you know, just like a euphemism. It's just the birds and the bees.
No, but they...
Do the birds do anything with the bees?
No, not at all. It was their parents-
Do they just take them out?
It was their parents used to sidestep the issue by saying things like, you know when a lady blackbird and a man blackbird, they meet, right, they make a little nest, and then because they're
In love they have an egg.
Yeah.
And that was it.
I understand that, that makes sense. But why the bees, why the birds and the bees?
Well, probably, erm...
I don't know.
I don't know you see, within nature, forgive my ignorance, within nature there is no relationship between bees and birds is there?
Well no, not at all, no, not at all.
Nothing's going on.

Probably what it was, it was their parents found it hard to say, you know daddy puts his penis up mummy's vagina. It was much easier to say, like, in the insect world billions of them queue up and just fill the queen with spunk for about a day.
Sure.
You know, thus avoiding the embarrassing intercourse.
Exactly.
That's what I think Karl.
What do you think?
Were you taught about the birds and the bees, did anyone bring that up with you?
No, it's just in that class weren't it when they put a video on-
No that's what we had, we had a film
And they just said here you are, watch that and then, er-
What film though, Basic Instinct?
It's just like, you know, two people and all sat round the telly and watched it. One girl fainted.
Ricky laughs
And they said right, that's that. Next week, you know...
Prisms, or whatever.
And did it teach you everything you need to know?
Er... well how much do you need to know to know?
Yeah, true, no true. Except one kid in my class still thought of baby came out of an arse. What didn't he understand.
I think what they should have shown on those videos is technique as much as anything.
Yeah. Yeah, I suppose so yeah.
Because it was largely just instructional.
Wooing.
Mm. What it didn't tell you was how to get into a position where this might be of some interest.
That should have been the first four weeks of the course.
Yeah. Well, obviously that baby, that kid who had a baby, what was going on there Karl?
That was weird, did you see that?
Yeah, that was gonna be your favorite program wasn't it?
Yeah, wasn't that good in the end.
Why?
You told us about the story ages ago.
Ages ago. Told you about a year ago about a baby that had a baby.

Yeah bit different, the baby that had a baby, isn't it, where it was a Siamese twin with a, with a breach actually just, you know, developing inside him for you know... just, well, it wasn't even developing it was a twin stillborn
That just was inside, enveloped in the other one's body. So it's a little bit different to "a baby what had a baby", isn't it? Actually disappointed he was. You know what he said to me?
He went, "well, I thought it was going to come out and go 'oh I'll bloody I'm seven, what a waste of me life'".
Like it had been there going, "Hello?? Hello??"
Knock knock knock
"Seven!"
Idiot.
Yeah.
Yeah bit disappointing, but there was a program after that, right?
10:00 on Discovery and I haven't got Discovery.
Was it good?
Well I didn't see it, this is it. I was going to say to people if they've got a copy of it on tape if they could send it in.
What was it?
About a baby with four legs.
Right.
That's that was on at 10:00 on-
It wasn't a puppy?
No no.
Ricky laughs
"What's it doing up there?" "It's my baby." "Oh, is it ma'am? Alright, fine." Yeah.
That's got four legs. Yes. Yes, sometimes they do.
Look dad's gone. He's never coming back. You've got to get over it.
Ricky laughs
So, if anyone's got that... send it in.
Right, okay.

Ohh, dear. Send it in. So you want the tape with the baby with four legs. You're going to be disappointed again. It's not going to be like a baby with four legs who's running around - running up the curtains, you know what I mean? It's not going to be that. There's probably - it's probably gonna be two legs and then two sort of like, floppy appendages. You know what I mean?
It's not - they're not going to be brit... It's not going to be like Jake the Peg. You're going to be disappointed.
Apparently Lanzarote is one of the Canary Islands.
Oh is it?
Although we've also been told it's part of Spain.
Right... yeah.
I don't know who to believe.
I don't know what to believe either. That puts me back because I knew it was either one of them.
Yeah...
Pilot knows doesn't he?
Eh?!
Pilot knows where he's going.
I'd have thought so, yeah.
Doesn't matter then. Right, are we playing J-Hawks.
Got bored with that conversation, did you?
Long and winding road. I love that but, I don't like the way Mccartney sings "here". It was just one he goes - "and you leave me waiting he-ore".
Well he's always got that slightly affected... style.
But it sounds like Richard Burton or something - He-ore!
Yeah

But it's only one it does it. But I don't know why. Do you think he likes it, or wants to go back and change it. Maybe it's like... but having said that you know, I'm not [inaudible] them over, the Beatles are one of the best bands ever.
Well yeah, good luck to them.
Brilliant songwriters. Yeah. Yeah.
Ummm, we've had a lot of emails Karl, I don't really want to sort-of put a damper on your Christmas but a lot of people have been slagging off Lanzarote.
What are they saying?
Well one of them...
It is Canaria isn't it, it's Gran, it is one of the Canaries isn't it?
It's a volcanic island covered in volcanic dust. It's very windy, so you have to dig a hole to sit in on the beach. And there's hardly anything to do.
Ricky starts laughing.
That's from Mike G and he says "unless you like quad biking". Well, you know, you've seen what happened to Ozzy Osbourne.
No don't go quad biking! Not with your little head!
There's no protection at all, is there.
I don't know what you're thinking. I don't know -
At least Rik Mayall and Ozzy had lots of hair. [muttering] yours would... you would be like Humpty Dumpty, it would crack like a little egg [muttering] and there's no Kings Or King's Horses
Well they couldn't do the job anyway.
No, shouldn't really send them. They're not really a qualified.
Horses are not equipped to put back [inaudible] together again.
Send in a medical man like Neil Fox in.
Yes
To mend eggs.
Not some kind of military horse.
I bet he's had egg on his face a few times hasn't he.
What Foxy?
Yeah.
Well.., most of the series of Pop Idol.
Right, Karl Lanzarote. Good or bad. You've gotta' give it a go, haven't you.
Yeah. Well done.
Give everywhere a go.
Exactly. That's what I'm saying. You know, don't just take the word for it. I mean, I mean if it had said on Ananova, Lanzarote was shit, he'd have believed it.
Sure.

You know. If he'd overheard it in a pub - "Lanzarote is crap". He'd have believed it. If he'd seen it on a website, that was mainly concerned with monkeys and witches - he'd have believed it. As it is...
Everybody...
E'raves about New York, when i went there i thought it was rubbish.
Well you're an idiot then because is the-
Subjective though innit?
The greatest city in the world, along with London.
Subjective, though. That's why they have already programs n' that innit? You see and you decide for yourself n that.
Yeah, but you saw Venice, on a 'oliday programme, as you put it. You went there and you went "it was rubbish, full of black bin liners".
Well it is!
Right. Didn't they show them?
It stunk.
Didn't Judith Chalmers say that? " Oh, it stinks here and there's loads of rubbish everywhere".
No, she didn't
Didn't she mention that?
No. That's what I mean.
So depends what you want from a holiday, dun't it?
Well, yeah, but.
So.
You're an idiot if you don't like New York, so, next!
Anyway c'mon, break it up guys. Kiss and make up.
Yeah

Um Karl, we've had an email. Some old rockbusters. Ummm someone's emailed in, they wonder if you can get some of your old rockbusters clues, some of your old genuine rockbusters clues come back. I know rockbusters has come back lately.
Well course he can, it's the way his brain works.
Well indeed, but look, i think you'll, maybe can also enjoy the challenge, Rick.
Yeah
And you at home.
I remember them as well because I remember how angry they made me.
Here's some old rockbusters
That army's got some well nice trenches. DW.
Errr. That army's got some well nice trenches.
DW.
No.
Dandy Warhols.
That one works.
Not bad. Is it?
That's why I didn't get that one, because it worked.
Yeah.
Yeah.
Okay. She's only got one sticker left.
It was actually he's only got one sticker left.
Oh okay, he's only got one sticker left
Oh the band "his last sticker".
Exactly.
With Justin Fischman. Yeah, "his last sticker".
Brilliant weren't they? What happened to "his last sticker". Are they still going?
He'll strap some chocolate to your feet. That's A. A band or artist, A. He'll strap some chocolate to your feet.
Go on.
Aerosmith.
I don't know really what that means. But, and finally you'll have to-
Aero cobbler. The well known...Aero cobbler.
And, you'll have to stick her in the oven, AB. You'll have to stick her in oven.
See, he thinks that blacksmith, means like, just shoes. It's the smith part. A smith is just a right, isn't it? I don't know. Aerosmith. What does that mean, Karl? What does that mean?
Well, come on. You have to stick it in the oven, AB.
Yeah, I know that one.
Yeah?
Yeah.
What is it?
But it doesn't work.
Apparently it does. You'll have to stick it in the oven, AB. A singer or artist.
Well, Anita Baker.
Anita Baker.
But why do you have to stick it in the oven?
I need to bake her.
Oh, I need to?
Yeah.
Why didn't you say, he's got to get his hair cut and put a nice white chefs hat on. That's "a neater baker".
See, that works.
That works, Karl. I need to bake her, doesn't work. It is shite.
C'mon. Well before you judge, listen to today's Rockbusters. They're here with us now, here's Karl Pilkington.
Brought it back. Just for Christmas, but I've only got two really.
Oh, what!?
Oh, Christ.

Well, because i was trying to work one out before, righ in my little room. I was looking at different band names thinking, "what can i do", couldn't concentrate because Ricky was in there try out spray deodorant all over the place.
Alright!?
Well, you should have done them yesterday.
You should have shut me out!
Right.
So there's just two!? Brilliant.
Well, i've kind of got an idea for the third one.
Oh, fine.
Oh.
I'll have go. Right. so anyway, so the first one-
Shall we play a record and get back to this? Because this is doing me head in.
We'll do it quicker. We'll do it quicker.
No.
No. Play a record, this is rubbish. Rubbish
Libertines.
Useless
Give me the gifts, let me have a look at the prizes we've got.
Libertines. Don't Look Back Into The Sun, on Xfm. Well, the general public are getting involved with Karl's holiday. And, I mean, this has been a damning report on Lanzarote.
There's not been a positive word written about Lanzarote so far.
Well, it's volcanic. There's no natural water supply.
Apparently there's no natural water supply. It's all imported.
You have to sit in a hole. What do you think of this Karl? What do you think of the people
That want you to know you're going to a rubbish place, when you can't change it? What do you think of that?
Won't be rubbish though, will it?
What do you mean?
Be alright.
What do you mean, it will be alright?
Because I'm going to go there thinking. Oh, there's no water and that, and there will be water.
No, they didn't say "there's no water".
What did they say then?
There's no natural water supply.
Well. Whatever. I'm not bothered. It doesn't bother me.
Right.
I'm going to have a good time n that.
What are you gonna, what do you plan to do?
I've got a book.
What book you got?
Rich Hall book. I'm just gonna read that.
Brilliant.
The weather's better than here, innit?
Yeah
So. I'll have a goods time.

Someone, er. Someone just emailed in just now. They're listening online and there's a problem with their computer, and everything is sped up. The music is sped up. Our voices, Rick, are sped up. Everything is sped up, except Karl's. That's how slow he speaks.
When everything i sped up. He sounds normal.
Are we doing rockbusters?
Yeah. C'mon.
Listening online. Wow.
Steve, do you wanna...do you wanna do the clues?

I won't do the clues. I'll never be able to piece them together. But i'll give you the prizes. The Old Grey Whistle Test volume 2, the Kumar's at Number 42 volume 2, or maybe it's volume 1 - who cares. Porridge Series 3, volume 2. The Office complete second series on VHS for anybody who's still got grandparents, and U2 A Best of 1990-2000, and Smash Hits the Reuinion, that'll be the stuff you love. Spice Girls are on their, Libery X, Atomic Kitten.
Karl, do you see that? See, Steve's enthusiastic even though the competition's rubbish the prizes are second rate.
Steve is going "well not going to punish London", right? "I'm going to big it up". You're there "oh ffff-in well yeah". Know what I mean? C'mon.
Clue one.
Right here's the first one.
Clue one.
C'mon. Clue one. C'mon!!!!
Shut up.
C'mon.
Can't do any photos, because it's been nicked by a German.
What!? Right, start again.
Owwww, crrr what!
Clue one. Rockbusters. Clue one.
Ok, this is Rockbusters with Karl Pilkington!!! Go!!
I can't do any photos because it's been nicked by a German.
And what's the initial?
AC.
Right?
Next.
Second clue. If you keep eating, this bit of your body will get bigger. PC. PC. It's an artist or a band. Who is it? PC.
If you keep eating, this part of your body will get bigger. Right?
Yeah.
And, the last one, i'm not really sure about.
Umm...If you....
He's actually winging it now!
Imagine if this was Mastermind! I'm not sure but I know your specialist subject...
COME ON!
Is uhh...
OKAY GO!
The place where you go to... take your dog a walk, and that.
"The durr, the place where you go to take your dog a walk"
Oh forget it then.
NO DO IT!
Do it!
DO IT! Guh... you...
Xfm outro plays.
Tim Burgess - Oh My Corazon
Tim Burgess. Oh my "Corazon" is that? what's that mean?
I've no idea.
Phone and if you know.
No don't bother.
Oh email then, at least.
Okay.
I like to know these things.
Sure. Um, we were doing Rock Busters just before the ads and the record, Rick. I know you were enjoying it.
Yeah, come on get this clue out, karl, there was three. What is it?
Right. The first one was...
No. No, we don't want first two. What's the third?
Can't find the photos because it's been nicked by a German. Second one - if you keep eating. If you keep eating this bit of your body will keep getting bigger.
Yeah... it's different every time. Go on, what's the third one?
Errrm, where you take your dogs for a walk, and that, or you might go there on a Sunday.
What?
Errm, sort of...
OH JESUS CHRIST.
Shut. Just wait a minute. Please. Rick! Just be quiet, for just a moment.
Right! Okay, do this clue. Right, start from now. This is the third Block Buster. Sorry, Rock Buster clue.
That was a Freudian slip!
Yeah, God oh we'll get done. Right go on then, go!
Where you take your dog a walk.
Or you might go on a Sunday and that. Erm, people sort of, might taste that area.
Steve laughs.
Right?
Oh you are... it's rubbish!
Right, well the other one's A. P. as well isn't it? WHAT?
Ricky.gervais@xfm.co.uk
A. P.
A quick reminder of them again with the initials. Quick, go.
Oh this is such rubbish.
The first one - can't do any photos because it's been nicked by a German. Second one - if you keep eating...
What was the initial?
A. C!
Silence.
Don't get annoyed! That's what... The game's about the initials!
Yeah.
If you keep eating, (ricky groans) this bit of your body will get bigger, that's P. C.
Right...
Right, and where you take your dog maybe on a Sunday and go for a walk there and that, have a taste of it.
Ha, different!
A. P. just email in and you win some stuff.
Ricky.gervaise@xfm.co.uk
What rubbish, I wonder why we stoped this game.
Well, I think it's probably exhausted and he needs to go to some kind of volcanic dust island.
Ricky laughs.

With no water! just to dry out and get some new ideas. Ohh, I'd love to see you sitting there, on the, on these went black ash sands. Just sitting there going "I'm thirsty Suzanne. I've finished my Rich Hall book. I can't focus. I'm going blind. I need some water." Oh brilliant!
Bless him.
Anyway, Happy Christmas. We said we weren't getting nowt, didn't we. Right go on then.
Umm, hh dear, it was the premier... did you see the coverage, it was a premiere of Lord of the Rings part three?
Oh I can't be bothered.
I mean man alive, I'm sick of Lord of the Rings.
I watched the first one and I was actually quite... I've never been into all that sort of stuff.
Never liked it.
Gollum and Dungeons and Dragons and Gatekeepers and weird magic and Harry Potter makes... I want to punch his face in.
I know what you mean!
But I mean, it's sort of like, oh....
Well Lord of the Rings, when I was at school. If you're into that sort of thing, you are nerdlinger. They would beat you up, they'd shout... heckle abuse, that's sort of thing. I wasn't a fan.
I actually don't know anyone who admitted they were into that nonsense.
I know it was shameful. It was embarrassing. Now! the whole world's gone crazy for it!

Crazy for it. Even the tough guys, the hard nuts, the street-wise kids. They're loving it, can't wait for the third one. I see people raving about it. Jonathan Ross and all these people going "it's the best thing i've ever seen. I know. "I will smite you with my sword".
Yeah. It's just
Yeah.

Yeah it's exactly what i'm talking. Well they showed some coverage of the Lord of The Rings premiere on tv, and there were people dressed up as some of the characters.
